Turbines.Description: Turbines are used in wind farms to convert wind energy into electrical power.
Turbines are used in hydroelectric power plants to convert the energy of flowing or falling water into electrical power.
Turbines can be used in gas-fired power plants to convert the energy of burning natural gas into electrical power.
Turbines are commonly used in steam power plants to convert the energy of high-pressure steam into mechanical power, which can then be used to generate electricity.
